body_html:
Are you sure you don't want to use expect tests here? Obviously you'll have to do some legwork to expunge things like the stack traces, but if you ever make changes to the error messages (which you almost certainly will want to do), having --accept will be a lot more pleasant.

If you really want the messages inline in the file, I can code up a new version of --accept that can handle this.
body_text:
Are you sure you don't want to use expect tests here? Obviously you'll have to do some legwork to expunge things like the stack traces, but if you ever make changes to the error messages (which you almost certainly will want to do), having --accept will be a lot more pleasant.
If you really want the messages inline in the file, I can code up a new version of --accept that can handle this.
body:
Are you sure you don't want to use expect tests here? Obviously you'll have to do some legwork to expunge things like the stack traces, but if you ever make changes to the error messages (which you almost certainly will want to do), having `--accept` will be a lot more pleasant.

If you really want the messages inline in the file, I can code up a new version of `--accept` that can handle this.
